doc.course_introduction: Ubiquitous, on-demand network access to shared pools of configurable computing resources ideally requires minimal management effort or service provider interaction. This course covers the essential characteristics of data processing in the cloud, service and deployment models, and key components of implementing Amazon Web Services, as well as constructing Hadoop clusters and performing MapReduce operations.
doc.course_chapter: Getting Started//Data Management in the Cloud//Cloud-Based Data Management
doc.course_sub_chapter: [['Welcome!'], ['Introduction to Cloud Computing', 'Service Models', 'Deployment Models'], ['Amazon Web Services', 'AWS Computing', 'AWS Storage', 'AWS Queueing', 'AWS Interfaces', 'Auto-Scaling', 'Scalable Data Processing', 'AWS Security']]
doc.reviews: ['The course is good however It would be great if more details and options are provided', 'Interestingly!', 'Great course!', 'E', 'nice step move forward', 'Nice description of data management using cloud computing.', 'Great course in terms of theory about cloud services and AWS. But, without hands-on practice, this is waste of theory learnt.', 'Good course, really helpful in enriching my basic knowledge around data management and security concepts. Thanks to professor for generously sharing his wisdom and time for us.', 'it was amazing but language is not proper of professor. thank you ', 'Poor materials and hands on exercises.']
